Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The course absolutely accomplished my goal of an intensive semester of learning how to become a better writer. Simple in its structure, but I could not have asked for more.
This course was wonderfully designed and should remain as long as FES will allow.
For whatever reason, and maybe this is my own shortcoming, I found it very difficult to understand how to integrate writing concepts discussed in class to scientific/academic papers I have to write.

Great course, valuable for any student. The importance of communication skills is so often overlooked- not communication as in simply regurgitating facts but as in using language to eloquently express and inspire. I'm a better writer for taking this course, and good writing is essential for any environmental professional.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Verlyn slowly but surely imparts his wealth of writing knowledge to the class. Fun atmosphere and great way to improve writing.

Writing a piece each week and getting comments on it were really great. It was really hard to write an essay every week, but it became somewhat easier along with the semester. Also, reading classmates' writings was helpful to improve my writing skill, by comparing theirs with mine.
Its simplicity and Professor Klinkenborg's willingness to do anything possible (moving assignments, direction of discussions, etc.) to accomplish his goal and actually teach us.
The writing feedback andability to humbly step into your own voice.
Getting to write personal stories and trying to write fiction.
The forced writing! And the hilarious sentences.
Instructor's experience
Weekly writing.
Writing assignments and their discussion.
Weekly writing forced me to improve.
The Professor. Hands down one of the best I've ever had for writing. I actually feel like my handwriting improved tangibly.

It was incredible how every part of the class was very clearly in service of the goal to teach us how to recognize and write good sentences and then string them together into good paragraphs and string those together into good pieces. The readings were short enough and varied enough that we could discuss them in detail and parse out the nuances of each sentence. The weekly assignments were deceptively difficult but I learned a lot about my writing and my interests by struggling to find a subject I cared enough about to spend two pages and several hours working out one sentence at a time.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: None.
I would have liked to read, in class, an example of good scientific writing.
Classroom sessions became redundant as the semester wore on.
Discussion of class material. Sometimes too vague.
Nothing really. It was a great class.

In some ways, I wish the class had been smaller so that we could have bonded as a group and felt like we were "all in it together" instead of just a collection of individuals with individual problems. However, I'm also glad that so many people got a chance to be in the class because the lessons that Verlyn wanted to teach were valuable for anyone and everyone.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Writing a casual, but clear essay is really important to pursue a professional career. This class gave me an opportunity to practice my writing skill by doing numerous readings written by professional writers and classmates and writing essays on regular basis.

I sought a course that would help me become a better writer. SOM doesn't offer anything. I was honored to be get into this class, and truly believe it made me a better writer. I leave with confidence in knowing I now possess a skill (in progress) that few of my peers do.
I love to write and think it's important to be a good writer to communicate science better.
I want to be a writer, this is my world.
Yes, learning to write well is a skill every student needs. This knowledge is used everyday.
Everyone in our field should be able to communicate their thoughts in a clear and interesting manner.

This course is more fundamental than something that belongs to one particular "program." Good writing should be the base of any discipline and this class made me realize how rampant bad writing is among respected scholars and policy-makers and how vitally important it is for people in any program to start from the basics and focus on how each sentence should work in order to make their ideas clear, intelligible and interesting to read.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: to improve my writing skills.
I really wanted to improve my reading and writing skills. Looking back, it was a great choice to take this class.
See Q17.
I wanted to improve and find my voice as a writer.
To improve my writing skills.
I love to write and think it's really important.
To improve my reading and writing skills.
To hone my writing skills and take a course outside my realm.
To improve my writing skills
Improve my prose.

I wanted to have a chance to practice my writing without the pressure of having to produce a finished piece of writing at the end of the semester. What I think is most important about writing is the process and the attention to sentence-level detail and that was exactly what this class promised to do.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yup
Yes. I need to practice it more, but it learned a lot from this class.
Very much so.
yes!
Somewhat.
YES
Yes, and more
Yes, far beyond my expectations. I am a confident writer and critical reader.
Yes
Yes!

Absolutely. This class surprised me with the things I would learn about my writing process, my interests and how I express myself on paper. Also, I came out of the class with new appreciation and experience in reading the work of skilled writers in all fields.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: The writing style that we are learning from this class is not the one that we have been learning for the last few years. So people might feel uncomfortable with the new writing style. However, I guarantee that they will be able to learn a lot by following the professor's guidance.
Absolutely take it. You learn a ton, the workload is very manageable, Professor Klinkenborg cares about his students and their success as much as any professor I've had contact with.
Definitely be willing to be open to critique and be able to laugh at yourself. You will do fine
Make sure you have a good background in grammar, otherwise work on that first.
Start your pieces earlier in the week. You'll get a lot more out of writing them if you give yourself enough time.

I would recommend this class for everyone and anyone. You will learn, through the course of the semester, the satisfaction of being able to write beautiful, accurate and powerful sentences about whatever you chose. The weekly assignments can be challenging because there are never any prompts, but having to choose what I wanted to write about every week, helped me discover the things that feel significant and important to me and also helped me focus on the very basics of how I construct sentences. Verlyn is a compassionate and encouraging teacher, always willing to answer any questions and help with any struggles. It is incredible how much your writing will change in the course of 12 weeks.
